title: Robert Costello, Michael Cohen’s former legal adviser, to appear before Trump grand jury
description: Robert Costello, Michael Cohen's former legal adviser, said that he will appear before the Trump grand jury investigating a hush money payment to Stormy Daniels.

title: UBS reportedly offers to buy Credit Suisse for up to $1 billion
description: Swiss banking giant UBS on Sunday offered to buy its embattled rival Credit Suisse for up to $1 billion, according to the Financial Times, citing four people with direct knowledge of the situation.

title: TikTok now has 150 million active users in the U.S., CEO to tell Congress
description: When TikTok CEO Shou Zi Chew testifies before Congress, he will unveil new internal data that suggests the app's more enmeshed in U.S. lives than anyone realizes.

title: How Midwest roots shaped Ron DeSantis' political values and perspective
description: Florida Gov. Ron DeSantis has never lived in Youngstown, Ohio. But this corner of the Midwest has shaped him, since it's where his family has its roots.

title: Navajo Nation’s quest for water and justice arrives at the Supreme Court
description: The Navajo Nation goes before the Supreme Court in a water rights case it says is about ending nearly two centuries of injustice.

title: Trump-DeSantis drama casts a shadow over House GOP retreat in Florida
description: House Republicans head to Florida this week for their annual retreat — straight into the belly of the beast of the 2024 presidential primary campaign.

title: People are buying copycat versions of Ozempic and Wegovy. Is that safe?
description: Some pharmacies are offering different versions of weight-loss drugs Wegovy and Ozempic. What's in them and are they safe?

title: Manhattan D.A. says attempts to intimidate office won’t be tolerated after Trump’s call for protests
description: Manhattan District Attorney Alvin Bragg sought to reassure his staff in an internal message Saturday that intimidation or threats against them would not be tolerated.

title: Police say Michigan rappers' triple homicide is gang-related and ask for tips
description: Investigators probing a triple homicide that left three rappers dead earlier this year in suburban Detroit said Friday the slayings were the result of gang violence and had nothing to do with music.
